content.intro: M2: Energy Access and Inclusive Energy Services | Chapter 1

content.text: As one of the main components of SDG 7, energy access plays a pivotal role in global prosperity. Access to energy and inclusive energy services are essential drivers of social progress and economic growth and are intertwined with fundamental human rights. Even so, 685 million people globally still lack access to energy. In many places, even where there are energy infrastructures, they may not be equitably distributed, or unaffordable leaving low-income individuals and entire neighborhoods in energy poverty. Additionally, the services may be intermittent, poorly installed and unsafe, presenting health hazards. The transition to sustainable energy provides an opportunity to correct energy access imbalances throughout the world. Chapter 1 introduces key concepts of energy access, emphasizing its role as a human right and a catalyst for unlocking development opportunities. It explores the persistent challenges of energy poverty and presents approaches to counteract social inequalities. Furthermore, tracking mechanisms are highlighted as essential tools for guiding effective policies and solutions.
